alert.note: Alert for Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Inner Channels from Kupreanof Island to Etolin Island; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Misty Fjords; Southern Inner Channels (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 4:29AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...WELL ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES FOR EARLY THIS WEEK... Warm weather with well above normal daytime highs will persist through at least Tuesday for Southeast Alaska. Temperatures will rise to highs ranging from the mid 70s over more southerly locations to the mid 80s over northern and central locations and Misty Fjords. To minimize impacts of the heat wave, locate fans for cooling; wear light-colored and loose fitting clothes when outdoors; drink plenty of fluids, apply sun protection, and take breaks if you must be outdoors for extended periods; do not leave young children and pets unattended in closed vehicles; and plan to check on the elderly, those who are home-bound, and other loved ones and neighbors who could be more vulnerable. The very warm temperatures will continue to cause snow and ice melt to keep larger rivers systems at high levels. This weather pattern has been known to favor thunderstorm activity, particularly during late afternoons and evenings.
